name: Marriott Hotel Liverpool City Centre

reviews.text: Well-placed central hotel. Minutes from main train station Liverpool Lime Street, and bus station on doorstep. Mainly frequented by business types, but fine. Has a gym/spa facility and breakfast is decent self-service. Wi-fi free in public areas, though the charge for 24 hours is £15, or £6 an hour.
reviews.title: Well-placed central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2 smallish lifts, 1 of them was not working, but it wasnt a problem.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location, close to Lime Street Station. However it's proximity to the centre of the city has it's drawbacks due to the amount of noise at night. We found it impossible to sleep due to the noise outside and the idiots banging on doors throughout the night. The rooms are clean and the breakfast excellent. Good place to stay if you can sleep with the constant barrage of noise.
reviews.title: "A Real Gem"

reviews.text: My husband and I have just arrived back from the Marriott Hotel in Liverpool (stayed 6th Sept 2013) and were very pleased with the service we received. The Hotel receptionists are a credit to the Company! So friendly, helpful, happy and full of knowledge of the city. It makes a real change to see that. We stayed on the 5th Floor and have to say the room was large, spotless and faced the front of the hotel. Beds were very comfortable, luxury pillows and bedding. This hotel is very central to everything you need in Liverpool. At the back of the hotel there are many restaurants, bars and shops. Also you are near the huge railway station and bus services. The breakfast had plenty of choice, buffet style and not in queue in sight!
reviews.title: Central location, good for transport links and as a base for Liverpool's sites

reviews.text: Sadly we didn't have time to visit the pool and spa, but they looked amazing. I would recommend anyone to stay in this very friendly hotel. I hope to return soon.
reviews.title: WORST SLEEP EVER

reviews.text: This is a great hotel right by Lime Street Station. Immaculately clean rooms, comfortable enormous bed, room service dinner was good, as was the buffet breakfast. Lovely swimming pool. Staff were incredibly helpful. A couple of bad marks though. £15 per day for Internet access is outrageous, Marriott aren't the only hotel chain to charge through the nose for Internet use, but it is one of the highest charges I've come across. I had a floodlight outside my window which kept my room (631) as bright as day all night. My advice is that if you get a room with a floodlight outside it - MOVE. Otherwise a good mid range chain hotel
reviews.title: Great hotel 2 minutes from lime street station
Goodnight
reviews.text: The staff on the desk could not be more helpful. I have to say I did have a goodnights sleep, but the has to be a but! One of the lifts did not work and waiting for the second lift, well put it this way I gave up waiting by the way our room was on the 6th floor. So if you have any health issues make sure the lifts work or ask for a lower floor room. The breakfast was ok, But (I know buts everywhere) the restaurant was cold should have had it in our room (breakfast:-) that is.

My wife and I have just stayed at the marriot. They were faultless. There wasa hickup checking in but that was sorted with no fuss. The room we had was well appointed and it even had a jacuzzi bath. The bar prices arent bad for a large city centre hotel. Breakfast was excellent. Car parking is in a secure csr park next to the hotel. The hotel is well situated for the major city centre attractions. Well worth considering.
reviews.title: Good time

reviews.text: Good location - near the central Railway station [about 2 mins walk]
reviews.title: Good but

reviews.text: Rooms are good - and if you want a good nights sleep - ask for those overlooking the Courtyard and lower down.
reviews.title: Good location, excellent service

reviews.text: Managed to get into this hotel after checking out of the one we were originally in as it was so bad. Luckily this one was much much better! Reception were friendly, polite & willing to help in any way they could. Rooms were clean & functional. Location was very good - only a brief walk from Lime Street station. Car park is nearby too. Breakfast was good, although the chef doing the omelettes got slightly overwhelmed with things so there was a queue waiting for them, but other than that it's a hotel well worth staying in. A typically good Marriott.
reviews.title: Very pleasant.

reviews.text: Nice hotel, friendly staff. I would stay here again for sure. I received extra special service from Ronnie, the concierge, and Eve in houskeeping.
reviews.title: Great location in Liverpool!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was clean. Didn't care for the elevators...
reviews.title: Good location, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hope to visit again soon.
reviews.title: Large room and comfy bed!

reviews.text: Straight out of the station and into our hotel - what more could you ask for on arriving in a new place? The welcome was particularly warm and friendly, the room was clean, cool and comfortable. Once we had unpacked we were able to dive straight into Liverpool, as we were in the middle of everything. There were good places to eat right by the hotel and outstanding places within a short walk. During our stay there (3 nights) we had a small problem that was very quickly and professionally deal with. Our room looked out over Queen Square, with its bars and restaurants and we did wonder if noise might be a problem at night, as it was a particularly hot weekend, but we need not have worried. We never heard a thing and slept the sleep of the blameless (and well fed) every night.
reviews.title: Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed for 4 nights. Location cannot be messed with. directly accross the street from main train station and 5-10 minutes walk to everything you need as far as Liverpool ONE, Beatles pubs and many other things. I cant comment on staff as i only talked to the lady when i got my key card and when i turned it back in. but she was nice both times.
reviews.title: Location AMAZING, great room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the only knock i have and i didnt deduct a point for it because it is a marriot chain issue (at least in my experience) and not solely a Marriot Liverpool one is the charge for Wifi..... every other hotel i stay at offers free wifi whether its the 2 star Enrico in London or the Hilton in Milan... but you have to pay in Marriot. So i definitely saved about 8 pounds and just walked 5 minutes to Mcdonalds and used the Wifi whenever i needed it
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel and centrally located

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed over the August bank holiday weekend and the city had a music festival on at the Albert Docks which added to our stay in he city. As for the hotel the room was a king size suite which was large and well equipped with hair dryer, trouser press, complimentary water and fruit. The bed was comfortable and the spa bath was a wonderful end to our day of shopping and sight seeing as it gave me renewed energy to explore the city at night. There are many restaurants and pubs within walking distance of the hotel and you are spoilt for choice. We had breakfast at the hotel the next morning and it was delicious and kept us going until late into the afternoon, unfortunately we didn't have time to use the gym or the hotel pool, overall I would stay at the Marriott again as there is so much to see in the wonderful city and they offer a first class service.
reviews.title: Brilliant staff, great location

reviews.text: The staff were exceptional during my stay. its been over 6 years since ive stayed at theMarriott and despite the new faces, the quality of staff has remained high, maybe even better. came to the hotel early, Kay, Michelle, David were friendly. Breakfast staff were brilliant ie. Justyna, Debbie, Nicola. Buffet breakfast was great. Had room service and despite being advise d the food will be up in 45 minutes, it came earlier! Liverpool is known for many things, considering the number of hotels they now have, hospitality is definately one of their strengths. I use to live up here and aside from the trasformation of the city, the peope that work in this hotel are brilliant. Just opposite Lime Street Station, and a stone throw away from the bus station, restaurants and museums. I'll be back!
reviews.title: Ideal Location

reviews.text: The hotel is very close to the centre and is ideal in that respect. It is also adjacent to the bus station but there was not a problem with any noise. Came down for a week of conferences in the Bt Conference Centre which was located in Albert Dock, approximately a 25 minute walk away ( I enjoyed the walk and proved to be a great start to the beginning and end of a day of sitting in a conference hall!!) initially started off in a smallish standard room but asked to be moved as was being disturbed by a noisy wedding reception. This was not a problem and got upgraded to a lovely big room which was ideal for a weeks stay. Would stay again in this hotel.
reviews.title: Not Worth A Single Penny

description: Famous for sports, entertainment and Beatlemania, Liverpool is a cultural centre with more museums and galleries than any city outside London. The Liverpool Marriott Hotel couldn't offer a better location, set within the art and cultural district overlooking vibrant Queen Square. Beautifully decorated during a recent refurbishment, our bedrooms offer air conditioning and luxurious bedding with cotton-rich linens and fluffier pillows. After a day of museum hopping or shopping, enjoy a swim in our indoor pool or a relaxing dinner at Olivier's.
